explanation:
- MHD_digest_auth_check_digest2: The target directly calls this function. To decide if the target violates the MISRA recursion rule you must inspect the full definition/body of MHD_digest_auth_check_digest2 to see whether it (directly or indirectly) calls MHD_digest_auth_check_digest.
- MHD_digest_auth_check_digest3: Static call-graph shows MHD_digest_auth_check_digest2 calls this function. You must inspect its definition/body (and its callees) to determine whether there is an indirect path back to MHD_digest_auth_check_digest.
- __builtin_unreachable: Appears as a callee of MHD_digest_auth_check_digest2 in the call graph. Although the builtin cannot introduce a recursive call, include it for completeness when examining the callees of MHD_digest_auth_check_digest2 so you can focus attention on only the user-level functions that could form a recursion cycle.
